com.saasovation.common.port.adapter.messaging.rabbitmq

Class Queue

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.saasovation.common.port.adapter.messaging.rabbitmq.BrokerChannel
      • com.saasovation.common.port.adapter.messaging.rabbitmq.Queue

  • public class Queue
extends BrokerChannel
    I am a queue that simplifies RabbitMQ queues.

      • instance

        public static Queue instance(ConnectionSettings aConnectionSettings,
                             java.lang.String aName)
        Answers a new instance of a Queue with the name aName. The underlying queue is non-durable, non-exclusive, and not auto-deleted.
        Parameters:
        aConnectionSettings - the ConnectionSettings
        aName - the String name of the queue

                             java.lang.String aName,
                             boolean isDurable,
                             boolean isExclusive,
                             boolean isAutoDeleted)
        Answers a new instance of a Queue with the name aName. The underlying queue durability, exclusivity, and deletion properties are specified by explicit parameters.
        Parameters:
        aConnectionSettings - the ConnectionSettings
        aName - the String name of the queue
        isDurable - the boolean indicating whether or not I am durable
        isExclusive - the boolean indicating whether or not I am exclusive
        isAutoDeleted - the boolean indicating whether or not I should be auto-deleted

        Parameters:

      • exchangeSubscriberInstance

        public static Queue exchangeSubscriberInstance(Exchange anExchange)
        Answers a new instance of a Queue that is bound to anExchange, and is ready to participate as an exchange subscriber (pub/sub). The connection and channel of anExchange are reused. The Queue is uniquely named by the server, non-durable, exclusive, and auto-deleted. This Queue style best works as a temporary fan-out subscriber.
        Parameters:
        anExchange - the Exchange to bind with the new Queue
        Returns:
        Queue

      • exchangeSubscriberInstance

        public static Queue exchangeSubscriberInstance(Exchange anExchange,
                                               java.lang.String[] aRoutingKeys)
        Answers a new instance of a Queue that is bound to anExchange, and is ready to participate as an exchange subscriber (pub/sub). The connection and channel of anExchange are reused. The Queue is uniquely named by the server, non-durable, exclusive, and auto-deleted. The queue is bound to all routing keys in aRoutingKeys. This Queue style best works as a temporary direct or topic subscriber.
        Parameters:
        anExchange - the Exchange to bind with the new Queue
        Returns:
        Queue

      • exchangeSubscriberInstance

        public static Queue exchangeSubscriberInstance(Exchange anExchange,
                                               java.lang.String aName,
                                               java.lang.String[] aRoutingKeys,
                                               boolean isDurable,
                                               boolean isExclusive,
                                               boolean isAutoDeleted)
        Answers a new instance of a Queue that is bound to anExchange, and is ready to participate as an exchange subscriber (pub/sub). The connection and channel of anExchange are reused. The Queue is named by aName, unless it is empty, in which case the name is generated by the broker. The Queue is bound to all routing keys in aRoutingKeys, or to no routing key if aRoutingKeys is empty. The Queue has the qualities specified by isDurable, isExclusive, isAutoDeleted. This factory is provided for ultimate flexibility in case no other exchange-queue binder factories fit the needs of the client.
        Parameters:
        anExchange - the Exchange to bind with the new Queue
        aName - the String name of the queue
        aRoutingKeys - the routing keys to bind the queue to
        isDurable - the boolean indicating whether or not I am durable
        isExclusive - the boolean indicating whether or not I am exclusive
        isAutoDeleted - the boolean indicating whether or not I should be auto-deleted
        Returns:
        Queue

      • individualExchangeSubscriberInstance

        public static Queue individualExchangeSubscriberInstance(Exchange anExchange,
                                                         java.lang.String aName)
        Answers a new instance of a Queue that is bound to anExchange, and is ready to participate as an exchange subscriber (pub/sub). The connection and channel of anExchange are reused. The Queue is named by aName, which must be provided and should be unique to the individual subscriber. The Queue is durable, non-exclusive, and is not auto-deleted. This Queue style best works as a durable fan-out exchange subscriber.
        Parameters:
        anExchange - the Exchange to bind with the new Queue
        aName - the String name of the queue, which must be unique, non-empty
        Returns:
        Queue

      • individualExchangeSubscriberInstance

        public static Queue individualExchangeSubscriberInstance(Exchange anExchange,
                                                         java.lang.String aName,
                                                         java.lang.String[] aRoutingKeys)
        Answers a new instance of a Queue that is bound to anExchange, and is ready to participate as an exchange subscriber (pub/sub). The connection and channel of anExchange are reused. The Queue is by aName, which must be provided and should be unique to the individual subscriber. The queue is bound to all routing keys in aRoutingKeys. The Queue is durable, non-exclusive, and is not auto-deleted. This Queue style best works as a durable direct or topic exchange subscriber.
        Parameters:
        anExchange - the Exchange to bind with the new Queue
        aName - the String name of the queue, which must be unique, non-empty
        aRoutingKeys - the routing keys to bind the queue to
        Returns:
        Queue
